subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class

Hi Cederic,


>  > Not true, this is a common mussunderstanding, protected is /less/
>  > restricted than package private
>
>  Can you expand on that?  A protected method can only be used from a subclass
>  while a package private method can be called from *any* class in that
>  package.

I meant exactly what I wrote and, no it does not work as you think. It
is a common missunderstanding. Protected methods can be used from
*any* method in the same package *and* from subclasses derived from
the class declaring the protected member.

I think the easiest thing is to just try it and you're in for a bit of
a surprise.

So in contrast to what a lot of people think actually less protected
than package private.

If you don't have the time to experiment here is a link to the Java tutorial:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html

I hope this clears things up tho it is not such a big deal.
Best regards!
/Joakim Ohlrogge
